channel.title: Home on Thoughts
channel.description: Recent content in Home on Thoughts

item.title: Uttar Pradesh background
item.description: Task Aggregate data on Uttar Pradesh Data Sourced from Wikipedia and Wikimedia commons Electoral calendar Table 1: Election calendar with focus on Uttar Pradesh Date Kind Election 2021 National Rajya Sabha 2021 State Vidhan Parishad: legislative assembly 2021 State Vidhan Parishad: nominated 2022 State Vidhan Sabha 2022 State Vidhan Parishad: legislative assembly 2022 State Vidhan Parishad: local authorities 2022 State Vidhan Parishad: nominated 2023 State Vidhan Parishad: teachers 2023 State Vidhan Parishad: graduates 2024 National Lok Sabha 2024 State Vidhan Parishad: legislative assembly 2025 No elections None planned 2026 State Vidhan Parishad: teachers 2026 State Vidhan Parishad: graduates Other information R packages used include magick1, rsvg2, rvest3, and, kableExtra4.

item.title: Household device power wattage
item.description: Task was to extract data from an html table of power wattage by devices and sort the table. Reference Data from DaftLogic Table 1: Household devices by wattage Appliance Minimum Maximum Standby Power Shower 7500 10500 0 Electric Tankless Water Heater 6600 8800 NA Electric Boiler 4000 14000 NA Hand Wash Oversink Water Heater 3000 3000 NA Hot Water Immersion Heater 3000 3000 NA Evaporative Air Conditioner 2600 2600 NA Corded Electric Handheld Leaf Blower 2500 2500 NA Steam Iron 2200 2500 NA Oven 2150 2150 NA Electric Heater Fan 2000 3000 NA Electric stove 2000 2000 NA Space Heater 2000 5000 NA Hair Blow Dryer 1800 2500 NA EV Home Charger 1600 3400 NA Air Fryer 1500 1500 NA Electric Mower 1500 1500 NA Induction Hob (per hob) 1400 1800 NA Espresso Coffee Machine 1300 1500 NA Inverter Air conditioner 1300 1800 NA 9"

item.title: Manipulating steel producer data in R
item.description: Sought to: import a data set with time series data in columns; transpose the data to a tidy set in which data was switched to rows and retain numeric data type. Create a factor variable on imported data to permit grouping data. From grouped data generate a cumulative frequency column and a relative frequency column using two methods. Provide alternate presentation of frequency data with chart. The data set used in this case was output in million metric tons of steel by the world’s top 50 steel producers as published by the World Steel Association.

item.title: India district broad data
item.description: Task: Extract table data of India districts from Wikipedia Combine each table rows into one dataframe; add a column to combined data frame that provides name of original dataframe - so as to facilitate identifying source of data reorder the columns in expanded data frame to put original data frame column first. There are 36 tables of India states and territories listed on the wikipedia page. Each table was extracted and stored in a separate data frame.

item.title: India China container port rank 2018
item.description: Task was to extract data from an html table and arrange it in a way to provide small conclusions from data. In this example sought to gain a sense of where India’s ports stand relative to world ports in terms of container thoughput. The ranking shows that India’s ports have some way to go to catch up with the throughput by many of China’s ports. After finding sample data from https://www.

item.title: random events
item.description: Task - random forward events Corporate links: BHP Suzuki Fanuc Nidec Toray NEC Nel Maruti Source for calendar is the TeachingDemos package in R.

item.title: Special day calendar
item.description: Task - R calendar generation to celebrate special day. Source: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/7919998/basic-calendar-display-in-r

item.title: Top 50 port throughput by country
item.description: Table of container throughout for top 50 ports sorted and ordered. The table provides additional history of container port throughput by country. Data is drawn from http://www.worldshipping.org/ by way of a google search into excel. Several modifications to data were made in excel. And then flat file in csv form was imported into R. Within R the data was sorted and tabulated. The value added to the data from the website was in ranking the data by 2018 column, splitting out port from country, filtering out records for China and India from the broader set of 50 top container ports.

item.title: Asset appraisal
item.description: Consider What we want to know in evaluation of investments. What has happened over the past two years? What has been purchased? Why were the assets purchased, purchased? How have they been doing? Why were they purchased that way? How do you make the purchases happen? What are the plans for the future? Why have these plans? What do you see for the future? How do we know for sure?

item.description:

Inspire creative thinking about what makes the co. unique; How does that link to purpose; Why it could be valuable? Encourage rigor in embedding. 3. keep purpose at forefront of mind; is purpose reflected on ground; 4.

item.title: Food consumption by country
item.description: Output from this script provides charts of consumption of various food categories (in terms of kg/person/year) by country. The data is sourced from Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations as of 2018 and published by nu3. The script extracts an html table data from the website, tidies the extracted data, and, generates charts. The script is virtually all written by Kasia Kulma. url <- "https://www.nu3.de/blogs/nutrition/food-carbon-footprint-index-2018" us_foodplot china_foodplot india_foodplot Japan_foodplot Nigeria_foodplot uschina_foodplot usindia_foodplot indiachina_foodplot franceus_foodplot franceindia_foodplot Table 1: Country list x Argentina Australia Albania Iceland New Zealand USA Uruguay Luxembourg Brazil Kazakhstan Sweden Bermuda Denmark Finland Ireland Greece France Canada Norway Hong Kong SAR.

item.title: Copper price
item.description: The trigger to the note is the recent rise in copper, iron ore, and, several agricultural commodities including rice and sugar. Iron ore and copper are typically associated with a rise in industrial activity. By examining the recent rise in context of past movements we hoped to gain a deeper appreciation of where things stand with these two commodities. A further hope was to setup a method to extract such price data for these price series efficiently in future.

item.title: Using bins on Japan company PEs
item.description: This note outlines a method for generating a frequency table with counts based on defined groups for the pe and market capitalization (in USD$) variables of a Japan company dataset. The data set is comprised of trailing pe computed for 2685 Japanese companies. The script code is modeled after that found at jdatalab Table 1: Price-earnings ratio for Japan stocks symbol section company industry p_e us 9202.

item.title: Remap factor levels
item.description: Further to data extract of human muscle group from Wikipedia the goal here was to remap the factor levels in the variable source. The intention is to shrink down the number of categories from 48 to 5 to simplify understanding of statistics to be performed on muscle groups in future. To achieve that the source variable in the data frame was converted to factor type. It was then duplicated.

item.title: Column add and reorder
item.description: Task: Extract table data from Wikipedia; Combine table rows into one data frame; Add a column to combined data frame that provides name of original dataframe - so as to facilitate identifying source of data Reorder the columns in expanded data frame to put orgin data frame column first. There are 48 tables of muscle groups in the human body listed on the wikipedia page. Each table was extracted and stored in a separate data frame.

item.title: Company announcement template: revenue mix
item.description: Mix Suzuki generated operating profit of US$2 billion from sales of US$32 billion in FY19 for a year on year decline of 34%. Management attributes the fall in revenue in FY19 to the slow down in India’s economy, the relative strength of the JPY to other currencies, and, the Coronavirus lock downs. The composition of Suzuki’s revenue and operating profit show clearly that car manufacturing is the core business for the group.

item.title: Learning about wheat and India
item.description: Background This report focuses on India’s share in the world’s grains industry. It is based on data provided by the United States Department of Agriculture’s Foreign Agricultural Service (FAS) with specific focus on India1. The May 2020 global market analysis report suggests that - so far - ``the COVID-19 impact on overall global consumption of wheat for food use has been minimal to date"2. It goes further to project that wheat production and consumption, along with corn and rice, will break record levels in excess of 768 million tons and 748 million tons in 2020/20213.

item.title: Company results template: balance sheet
item.description: Balance sheet secure Even though there was a draw down of cash during the year Suzuki’s balance sheet remains strong with ending net cash and securities of JPY1677 billion or US$15 billion equivalent to JPY3,579/share. In light of ongoing uncertainties in the durability of future demand management has flagged that it intends to continue to strengthen the balance sheet. ## Item FY2019 FY2018 pct abschange ## 1: debt 404193 375437 7.

item.title: Company results template: headline numbers
item.description: Headine figures Suzuki announced a 10% reduction in net sales for the year to JPY 3488 billion or US$32.4 billion. Operating income fell 34% to JPY 215 billion or US$2 billion. Earnings per share declined 28% to JPY286/share. Despite the reported decline registered and further weakness projected ahead the company balance sheet remains strong and management declared a special dividend. ## Item FY2019 FY2018 pct abschange ## 1: net_sales 3488433.

item.title: Company results template: initial financial prep
item.description: Financials Suzuki Motors (7269.T, JPY3700) announced year end FY2019 (April 2019 through March 2020) results that show a decline in net sales and earnings. In the following articles will examine. headline earnings; revenue and operating profit mix; balance sheet position; cash flow generation and use; ratio analysis; consensus earnings outlook; valuation. But for now will assemble input data that will then wrangle into a form suitable for future analysis and presentation.

item.title: Company results template: share price
item.description: Purpose Thought process and actions steps following on earnings announcement. The example am using is the fourth quarter results posted by Suzuki Motors (7269.T, JPY3700) for period ended 2020-03-31. Recent price performance Recent price analysis versus benchmarks show the shares of Suzuki remain 26% below the peak in the year and below that of the Nikkei and Dow Jones. ## `summarise()` regrouping output by 'symbol' (override with `.groups` argument) ## # A tibble: 3 x 6 ## # Groups: symbol [3] ## symbol company curr_price min_price max_price pctchange_from_max ## <fct> <fct> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> ## 1 ^N225 N225 Index 22864.

item.title: India wheat markets - work in progress
item.description: Objective India is one of the world’s largest producers of wheat. There are two harvests in a year - the rabi harvest between May and June - and the kharif harvest in October and November. Several important festivals take place around the october harvest period. Given the significance of the farming sector to India in terms of consumption as well as employment have sought to examine quantities of wheat deliveries to market at harvest.

item.title: Moving grains - dry bulk
item.description: Conclusion initial examination of one balance sheet item for dry goods shipping sector shows that most companies carry a reasonably high debt load. GNK emerges as one of the stronger company balance sheets. SHIP among the weakest. Further analysis on assets and cash flow will follow. Trigger to enquiry The decline in the Baltic Dry Index (BDI) to below 400 caught attention this morning. That level approaches a 25 year low and compares to 1000 in january 2020 and 2500 in september 2019 (representing an 84% decline).

item.title: Learning R - Rice
item.description: Conclusions Estimated farmer pretax in India of around US$84 per 20 foot container of shipped rough raw rice. That represents a 78% reduction in take home pretax profit since start of 2020 when estimated pretax stood at US$340/container. Despite some increase in price since the start of 2020 farming profitability has fallen sharply. Trigger to enquiry Article in Economic Times of India (accessed: 2020-05-12) that reported today that Basmati rice exporters are suffering from higher shipping costs as a result of lack of containers.

item.title: About
item.description: The theme used is that created by Yihui Xie. The theme has been chosen for its simplicity and minimalism. This is the first personal website have created with blogdown and Yihui seems to have done a great deal of work in this area. For help on the theme and website please visit Yihui’s site.
